title: Ingrid Marie
text:
Ingrid Marie is an <a href="apple">apple</a> <a href="cultivar">cultivar</a>.
It was cultivated by accident around 1910 on the premises of a school in <a href="H%C3%B8ed">Høed</a> on the island of <a href="Funen">Funen</a> in Denmark. It is a cross of the two English cultivars <a href="Cox%27s%20Orange%20Pippin">Cox's Orange Pippin</a> and <a href="Cox%27s%20Pomona">Cox's Pomona</a>.
The apple has a red, firm skin and the color continues into the flesh underneath the skin.
'Ingrid Marie' trees grow very well in a moderate warm and humid climate.
